intro: Urtica spatulata, commonly known as the broadleaf nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine stinging hairs, which can cause irritation upon contact. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands or along stream banks. Urtica spatulata is a member of the Urticaceae family, which includes other stinging nettles.
